data.text: And the
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land of your habitations, which I give unto you,
And will make an offering by fire unto the
Then shall he that offereth his offering unto the
And the fourth
Or for a ram, thou shalt prepare
And for a drink offering thou shalt offer the third
And when thou preparest a bullock
Then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offering of three tenth deals of flour mingled with half an hin of oil.
And thou shalt bring for a drink offering half an hin of wine,
Thus shall it be done for one bullock, or for one ram, or for a lamb, or a kid.
According to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to every one according to their number.
All that are born of the country shall do these things after this manner, in offering an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the
And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever
One ordinance
One law and one manner shall be for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you.
¶ And the
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land whither I bring you,
Then it shall be, that, when ye eat of the bread of the land, ye shall offer up an heave offering unto the
Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough
Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the
¶ And if ye have erred, and not observed all these commandments, which the
Then it shall be, if
And the priest shall make an atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it
And it shall be forgiven all the congregation of the children of Israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them; seeing all the people
¶ And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.
And the priest shall make an atonement for the soul that sinneth ignorantly, when he sinneth by ignorance before the
Ye shall have one law for him that sinneth through ignorance,
¶ But the soul that doeth
Because he hath despised the word of the
¶ And while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man that gathered sticks upon the sabbath day.
And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto all the congregation.
And they put him in ward, because it was not declared what should be done to him.
And the
And all the congregation brought him without the camp, and stoned him with stones, and he died; as the
¶ And the

Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue:
And it shall be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember all the commandments of the
That ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.
I
